dataObjects.subject: http://www.eol.org/voc/table_of_contents#Wikipedia
dataObjects.title: Aphanotorulus ammophilus
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: "Aphanotorulus ammophilus." Wikipedia, The Free Encyclopedia. 9 Dec 2013, 02:30 UTC. 24 Nov 2014 <http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Aphanotorulus_ammophilus&oldid=634442485>.
dataObjects.description:
The black spotted plecos (Aphanotorulus ammophilus), also known as L094,[1] is a species of benthopelagic tropical freshwater catfish in the family Loricariidae endemic to Venezuela, specifically the Portuguesa River basin.[2] Due to an initial erroneous publication, Aphanotorulus ammophilus was initially placed into Hypostomus instead of Aphanotorulus. However, because this species shows sexual dimorphism, has a relatively flatter shape, and has a jagged posterior edge of its oral disc, it was placed in the genus Aphanotorulus.[3]

References[edit]

  1. ^ "Aphanotorulus ammophilus, Armbruster & Page, 1996". Aquatic-Experts. Retrieved 2013-09-12. 
  2. ^ Froese, Rainer and Pauly, Daniel, eds. (2013). "Aphanotorulus ammophilus" in FishBase. April 2013 version.
  3. ^ "Aphanotorulus ammophilus". Planet Catfish. Retrieved 2013-09-12.
